Understate: The claim understates the fact that Gov. Chris Christie has been promoting his ethics reform package for more than a year.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Gov. Chris Christie has only recently come up with a new agenda for ethics reform in September 2011, ignoring his previous efforts and proposals.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that Gov. Chris Christie has just now come up with a new agenda for ethics reform.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Gov. Chris Christie has been discussing ethics reform since September 2010.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the delay in implementing the ethics reform package was due to other legislative priorities such as pension and health benefits reform and the state budget.
